Author: TwilightPunkster K64#7533
Content: @ronyi I actually had a talk with our CTO just moments ago, that a collaboration on a wallet "framework" would be good for security reasons. However, the issue is related to a NPM package, that should've been version locked - or maybe even fuzzed. I also agree with @Mylo - everyone has their own plans and own strategies.

Author: ronyi#5719
Content: I understand, but just was "lucky" coincidence, example Verus Enchanted used another NPM package('s). There will never be 0 security risk. Yes everyone has own plans and own strategies, but using same "framework" at once good and bad (more eyes see more). So far, luckily I haven't lost KMD or other coins and fortunately not even now. Thank you all members and handled this situation excellent! @TwilightPunkster K64 @Mylo  thank you

Author: Mylo#8306

it's definitely a wake up.   put % into a multisig, put % in cold (always offline, never been on network computer) wallet.

Author: lion#5837
Content: All this will be relevant when we have an easy dex wallet with an atomic swap function to buy confidentiality coins! Then there will be no need for special privacy of kmd! We need a whole ecosystem with a variety of functions and private transactions are not the only thing needed from the coin - any separate integrated mixing protocol and the like can provide this!

Author: alexoh#0560
Content:
Hi
I have a frustration, and I will ask again.

Since December 10, 2017, Agama has been loaded and has been dead.
At that time, I did not even know there was a wallet.dat file and just formatted it.

After installing new Acama purse, the KMD coin in my Agama purse is missing.
After that, the transaction history file after December 6, 2017 disappears. The transaction history for about 5 days should not appear at all.
At about 97.3%, it disappears from the last step.

The agama version used at that time is 23a. In previous versions, to get the interest, you had to do it manually (that is, when you send it from my agama to my wallet bitlex and then send it back to the agama)
However, the 23a version did not send it out, but the button was automatically pressed to add interest.

I've had a lot of chats here (https://komodo-platform.slack.com/), but all the chats are gone.

And while he was chatting, he told me:
"There are over 126,000 missing coins at any address."
I asked them if they could find out which address they were in, and they said they could not do it because they were a private company.

At the time, the only thing they said was that there was no way to recover wallet.dat.
I tried to recover the SSD from then, but I still can not recover it.

here ,
One of @Nabob, @PTY or me @ tarun.gulati admitted that version 23a had a lot of problems.

Author: alexoh#0560
Content: Please refer the ticket No.
